text.title: There is a Safe and Secret Place
text.author: Henry Francis Lyte

verse.line: There is a safe and se- cret place,
Be- neath the wings Di- vine,
Re- served for all the heirs of grace;
O be that re- fuge mine!
The least and fee- blest there may bide,
Un- in- jured and un- awed;
While thou- sands fall on ev- ery side
He rests se- cure in God.
He feeds in pas- tures, large and fair,
Of love and truth Di- vine;
O child of God, O glo- ry's heir,
How rich a lot is thine.
A hand al- migh- ty to de- fend,
An ear for ev- ery call,
An hon- ored life, a peace- ful end,
And heaven to crown it all!
